feed.title: Leah Helmrich
feed.subtitle: Hazel-eyed Ginger, Friend, and Artist. I have been making jewelry since I was 12 and can't wait to see what I make next! Not afraid to get my hands dirty, but afterwards, I enjoy getting cleaned up.

entry.title: Plush Pony Toys
entry.content: Following a rough pattern, I cut out between 15 and 30 pieces for each toy. Using colorful thread I stitched everything together and stuffed the various pieces. Using paint and paint pens I added details before sealing the plushes with scotch guard.
entry.summary: Following a rough pattern, I cut out between 15 and 30 pieces for each toy. Using colorful thread I stitched everything together and stuffed the various pieces. Using paint and paint pens I added details before sealing the plushes with scotch guard.

entry.title: Stage-Worthy Laundry Room Floor
entry.content: To create a more interesting and durable laundry room floor I used outdoor grade paint to put down a base coat and then blocked out basic stone brick shapes. Using a number of sponge and dry brushing techniques I added depth and color to create a floor reminiscent of a stone wall.
entry.summary: To create a more interesting and durable laundry room floor I used outdoor grade paint to put down a base coat and then blocked out basic stone brick shapes. Using a number of sponge and dry brushing techniques I added depth and color to create a floor reminiscent of a stone wall.

entry.title: Exploding TARDIS Shoes
entry.content: Based on a ficticious Van Gogh painting from the British TV show Doctor Who, I painted a pair of high top sneakers with a sci-fi scene using acrylic paint. I sealed the laces and shoes with Scotch Guard and use metallic paint pens to add a few extra details.
entry.summary: Based on a ficticious Van Gogh painting from the British TV show Doctor Who, I painted a pair of high top sneakers with a sci-fi scene using acrylic paint. I sealed the laces and shoes with Scotch Guard and use metallic paint pens to add a few extra details.

entry.title: Knotted and Vined Headphones
entry.content: After acquiring a pair of over-ear headphones that had a mesh covered band, I decided to jazz them up using some embroidery. Using an image I created from a few different pieces of clip art, I turned it into a rough pattern to follow, using silk embroidery floss to create the final design.
entry.summary: After acquiring a pair of over-ear headphones that had a mesh covered band, I decided to jazz them up using some embroidery. Using an image I created from a few different pieces of clip art, I turned it into a rough pattern to follow, using silk embroidery floss to create the final design.

entry.title: Needlefelted Teddy Bear
entry.content: Using reclaimed wool from a sweater I needle felted a fully articulated 6 piece teddy bear, creating the pattern for all the pieces though observation of a vintage bear.
entry.summary: Using reclaimed wool from a sweater I needle felted a fully articulated 6 piece teddy bear, creating the pattern for all the pieces though observation of a vintage bear.

entry.title: Jinx Cosplay Props
entry.content: The shark shaped rocket launcher, bunny eared machine gun, and electric pistol were created with cardboard boxes and containers that were shaped and covered with masking tape. Small details were made with cardboard, sheet foam, model magic, wire, and found objects. Everything was painted with acrylics and automotive paint for durability.
entry.summary: The shark shaped rocket launcher, bunny eared machine gun, and electric pistol were created with cardboard boxes and containers that were shaped and covered with masking tape. Small details were made with cardboard, sheet foam, model magic, wire, and found objects. Everything was painted with acrylics and automotive paint for durability.

entry.title: Lucky Clover and St. Pat’s Spirit Faux Nose Rings

link.title: Lucky Clover and St. Pat’s Spirit Faux Nose Rings

entry.content: Using the basic faux nose ring I designed, I added fringe beads using 24 gauge wire. I either added the beads directly onto the ring, to make a filigree style ring, or twisted up a tiny four leaf clover to then wrap onto the ring for a more whimsical nose ring.
entry.summary: Using the basic faux nose ring I designed, I added fringe beads using 24 gauge wire. I either added the beads directly onto the ring, to make a filigree style ring, or twisted up a tiny four leaf clover to then wrap onto the ring for a more whimsical nose ring.

entry.title: Jewel of the Sea Pendant
entry.content: Starting with sterling silver wire in 18 and 20 gauge, I cut 10-15 pieces and balled both ends. I roughly shaped the pieces and stacked them in a loose horseshoe shape. Using silver solder in wire form, I fused all the pieces together, focusing on the middle. Once everything was soldered, I began to finalize the shape, working in a little at a time with each tendril until the focal stone was securely pinned in place.
entry.summary: Starting with sterling silver wire in 18 and 20 gauge, I cut 10-15 pieces and balled both ends. I roughly shaped the pieces and stacked them in a loose horseshoe shape. Using silver solder in wire form, I fused all the pieces together, focusing on the middle. Once everything was soldered, I began to finalize the shape, working in a little at a time with each tendril until the focal stone was securely pinned in place.

entry.title: Fishbone Earrings
entry.content: I used 20 gauge sheet copper and cut small head and tail shapes out of it and made a post earring finding to be soldered to the head. Using 22 gauge sterling silver wire I fashioned a delicate spine to connect the pieces so they would dangle and swing.
entry.summary: I used 20 gauge sheet copper and cut small head and tail shapes out of it and made a post earring finding to be soldered to the head. Using 22 gauge sterling silver wire I fashioned a delicate spine to connect the pieces so they would dangle and swing.

entry.title: Chrysanthemum-esque Pendant
entry.content: Using 20 gauge sheet copper, I cut two flower pattern pieces out and filed all of the edges. I cut and domed an anodized aluminum disk for the center of the flower. Carefully bending the prongs in part way, I arranged the layers and then fully bent the prongs, locking the pieces together.
entry.summary: Using 20 gauge sheet copper, I cut two flower pattern pieces out and filed all of the edges. I cut and domed an anodized aluminum disk for the center of the flower. Carefully bending the prongs in part way, I arranged the layers and then fully bent the prongs, locking the pieces together.
